name: create-reciple
readme: --- ## About `create-reciple` is a tool used to easily create Reciple projects. ## Installation ```bash npm create reciple@latest yarn create reciple@latest pnpm create reciple@latest ``` ## Templates - Javascript (CommonJS) - Javascript (ES Modules) - Typescript (CommonJS) - Typescript (ES Modules)

blockTags.name: default
blockTags.text:
```ts
'https://registry.npmjs.org'
```

comment.description:
Downloads the tarball from the specified tarballURL if it hasn't been downloaded already.
Verifies the tarball's shasum against the stored tarballShasum.

blockTags.name: returns
blockTags.text: The downloaded tarball as a Buffer, or undefined if the tarballURL is falsy or the tarball already exists.

blockTags.name: throws
blockTags.text: If the tarball cannot be downloaded or if the shasum does not match.

comment.description:
Asynchronously fetches package metadata and downloads the tarball for the specified module.
If the metadata is already available, it will be used instead of fetching it again.

blockTags.name: returns
blockTags.text: The fetched package metadata.

comment.description: Reads the tarball and extracts the necessary data from it.

blockTags.name: returns
blockTags.text: The data extracted from the tarball.

blockTags.name: throws
blockTags.text: If the tarball is not downloaded or if the temporary directory does not exist.

comment.description: Verifies the tarball's shasum against the stored tarballShasum.

blockTags.name: returns
blockTags.text: A promise that resolves to a boolean indicating whether the shasum matches or not.

comment.description: The tarball buffer to be verified.
Cancels the prompts and exits the process with the given reason.

blockTags.name: returns
blockTags.text: - A promise that never resolves.

comment.description: The reason for cancelling the prompts.
Prompts the user for input to set up the necessary parameters for creating a reciple.

blockTags.name: returns
blockTags.text: A promise that resolves to the current instance of the Setup class.

comment.description: Whether to force override existing files in the directory.
Returns a SetupOptions object with the current setup details.

blockTags.name: returns
blockTags.text: The setup options object.

comment.description:
Builds the template by performing the following steps:
1. Initializes the spinner.
2. Creates the directory if it does not exist.
3. Copies the template files.
4. Copies the assets.
5. Sets up the package.json file.
6. Sets up the configuration.
7. Sets up the addons.
8. Sets up the environment.
9. Succeeds the spinner.
10. Installs dependencies if the package manager is specified.
11. Logs the project readiness message.
12. Logs the start developing message.
13. Logs the command to navigate to the project directory if the current working directory is not the project directory.
14. Logs the command to install all dependencies if the package manager is not specified.
15. Logs the command to run the dev script.

blockTags.name: returns
blockTags.text: A Promise that resolves when the build is complete.

comment.description: Copies the asset files from the root directory to the current directory.

blockTags.name: returns
blockTags.text: A Promise that resolves when the asset files are copied.

comment.description: Copies the template files to the specified directory.

blockTags.name: returns
blockTags.text: A Promise that resolves when the template files are copied.

comment.description: Installs dependencies by running a script with the package manager placeholders.

blockTags.name: returns
blockTags.text: A Promise that resolves when the dependencies are installed.

comment.description:
Sets up the addons for the template by installing the specified addons
and updating the package.json file with their dependencies. This function
takes no parameters and returns a Promise that resolves when the addons
are successfully installed.

blockTags.name: returns
blockTags.text:
A Promise that resolves when the addons are
installed.

comment.description:
Sets up the configuration for the `reciple.mjs` file by creating a new
configuration file in the specified directory. This function does not take
any parameters and returns a Promise that resolves when the configuration
file is successfully created.

blockTags.name: returns
blockTags.text:
A Promise that resolves when the configuration
file is successfully created.

comment.description:
Sets up the environment by updating the .env file with the Discord bot token.
If the file already exists, it reads the content and appends the token.
If the token is not already present in the file, it adds a comment and the token.
The function does not return anything.

blockTags.name: returns
blockTags.text: A Promise that resolves when the environment setup is complete.

comment.description: Configures the package versions and scripts in the package.json file.

blockTags.name: returns
blockTags.text: A Promise that resolves when the package.json file is configured.

comment.description: Retrieves and returns template metadata from the specified directory.

blockTags.name: returns
blockTags.text: An array of template metadata objects.

comment.description: The directory path to retrieve templates from.
Checks if a directory is empty by filtering out hidden files.

blockTags.name: returns
blockTags.text: True if the directory is empty, false otherwise.

comment.description: The directory path to check.
Recursively copies files from one directory to another.

blockTags.name: returns
blockTags.text: A promise that resolves when the copy is complete.

comment.description: The source directory path.
The destination directory path.
An optional function to rename files during the copy process.
Executes a shell command and logs the command before running it. If the command fails, the process exits with a status code of 1.

blockTags.name: returns
blockTags.text: A promise that resolves when the command has completed.

comment.description: The shell command to execute.
The current working directory in which to execute the command. Defaults to the current working directory.
